intro: Luthera, commonly known as the flame violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of about 1 to 2 feet. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in a fine, velvety texture. Luthera thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full shade in its natural habitat.
